Based on your preferences for humor in movies, here are two recommendations that I believe would fit those criteria:
  
  
  
  Restless (2006) - This movie is about a teenager named Ari who doesn't do relationships or attachments. His only focus is sex. However, everything changes when he meets Tiina. Together with Tiina and her closest circle of friends, this could be their last summer of freedom.
  
  
  
  True Blood (N/ A) - This TV series is set in the fictional town of Bon Temps, Louisiana, United States during the present day and the past. The series follows a group of vampires who live in the town with humans living nearby. The series explores various themes including love, relationships, sexuality, death, and more.
  
  
  
  Elysium (2013) - This science fiction movie is set in a dystopian future where most of humanity has died off as a result of climate change caused by pollution. The remaining few survivors live in an artificial space station called "Elysium." The main character is a former soldier named Mark Mitchell who now works as a private security consultant for Elysium. He is hired to investigate and solve various problems that arise on Elysium.
  
  
  
  Back to the Future Part II (1989) - This science fiction comedy movie is set in the present day and the past. The main character is a teenager named Marty McFly who lives with his parents, George Senior and Clara, Jr., in a suburban house in Hill Valley, Ohio, United States during the present day and the past.
The film follows Marty as he tries to change his future by visiting different time periods before 1955. He visits different locations around the world at different times throughout history including ancient Egypt, ancient Greece, ancient Rome, medieval Europe, early modern Europe, late modern Europe, early colonial America, colonial America, early United States, United States, early 20th century United States, 19th century United States, 20th century United States.
